metadata.title: CVE-2022-0812 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
An information leak flaw was found in NFS over RDMA in thenet/sunrpc/xprtrdma/rpc_rdma.c in the Linux Kernel. This flaw allows anattacker with normal user privileges to leak kernel information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-0812` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-5.4.0-45-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-generic - 5.4.0-45.49
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-45-lowlatency - 5.4.0-45.49
No subscription required

linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
linux-image-5.13.0-21-generic-lpae - 5.13.0-21.21~20.04.1
